entry.title: As Maui Fires Leave at Least 80 Dead, Some Residents Return
entry.content: The center of Lahaina remained barricaded and firefighters continued to extinguish flare-ups.

entry.title: Migrant Crossings on the Rise Again at U.S. Border
entry.content: Authorities say human smugglers are guiding migrants to some of the hottest and most isolated stretches of the Arizona desert as temperatures soar.

entry.title: Why Are the Maui Wildfires So Devastating?
entry.content: Dry conditions, low humidity and high winds helped fuel the blazes.

entry.title: A Cold War Mission Pays Off 65 Years Later
entry.content: Two Navy sailors were surprised when their once top secret work to lay acoustic cables in the ocean suddenly became front-page news in the Titan submersible search.

entry.title: 18 Years at Guantanamo Without Charge. Hundreds of Paintings.
entry.content: Ahmed Rabbani, released in February after being locked up for two decades as part of the U.S. war on terror, made art depicting life and torture in detention.

entry.title: Maui Wildfires Leave 80 People Dead: It's a 'War Zone'
entry.content: Disrupted internet service made it difficult to determine how many people were missing, and officials said they expected the death toll to rise.

entry.title: Hawaii Officials Were Warned Years Ago That Maui's Lahaina Faced High Wildfire Risk
entry.content: “It’s just really frustrating and heartbreaking to see that some things could have been done,” said the author of a 2014 report.

entry.title: When Lahaina Resident Needed to Escape Fire, She Plunged Into Sea
entry.content: Many people from the devastated Maui town fled in desperation, leaving their homes and possessions behind to burn.
